title: You can try the Crystal Maze in Manchester before anyone else
text:
You can try the Crystal Maze in Manchester before anyone else The real-life game will open for a number of preview days and tickets will be cheaper Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Denise Evans tries out the crystal maze Share this video Get What's On   Thank you for subscribing!   
This is your chance to have a go at the Crystal Maze in Manchester before it even opens. 
The new game, which has been inspired by the original TV gameshow, is set to launch at Old Granada Studios in April, but bosses have announced they are to open the maze for 10 special preview days. 
Preview gamers, who will be guided through the four zones by maze masters in true Richard O'Brien style, will 'test drive' the site before its grand opening on April 1. 
As a result, ticket prices have been reduced due to the possibility sessions may be disrupted as finishing touches are made. Read More 
The Manchester game follows on from the success of the London version , with many sessions in the first few months already snapped up. The Crystal Maze Experience in London - soon to be arriving in Manchester (Photo: Facebook) 
The experience involves a team of up to eight taking part in a series of individual games and puzzles in the Aztec, Industrial, Future and Medieval zones. Read More 
It will include 27 games not currently available in London and the zones will be bigger and more interactive. 
You can book individual tickets or full eight-person teams, with the experience lasting approximately two hours. 
Previews start on March 13, with solo tickets at £26.50 (regular £45-£55) and full group £210. 
To book and check which times are available for the preview days, take a look here . A mock-up of the Pyramid inside the Aztec Zone at the Manchester Crystal Maze 
You can also join the mailing list for ticket alerts. Like us on Facebook
